name: PNopt
body:
PNopt is a software package that uses proximal Newton-type methods to solve convex optimization problems in composite form. For details about these methods, please refer to [our paper](http://arxiv.org/abs/1206.1623).

## Usage
PNopt shares a similar interface with [TFOCS](http://tfocs.stanford.edu/), a popular software package for solving convex optimization problems in composite form. PNopt is also compatible with the suite of function generators included with TFOCS. To call PNopt, use:

```
[x, f, output] = PNopt(smoothF, nonsmoothF, x0, options);
```

The input arguments are 
* ```smoothF```: a smooth function
* ```nonsmoothF```: a nonsmooth function
* ```x0```: a starting point for the solver
* ```options```: an options structure created using the PNoptimset function
